themed_passages.title: The Tortoise and the Hare
themed_passages.text: A hare made fun of a tortoise for being slow. The tortoise challenged the hare to a race. The hare ran fast but stopped to nap, thinking he had plenty of time. The tortoise kept going slowly but surely. When the hare woke up, the tortoise had already crossed the finish line.
themed_passages.theme: Slow and steady wins the race
evidence: The tortoise kept going slowly but surely
the tortoise had already crossed the finish line

themed_passages.title: The Boy Who Cried Wolf
themed_passages.text: A shepherd boy got bored watching sheep. He cried 'Wolf!' to get attention. The villagers came running but found no wolf. He did this again and again. One day, a real wolf came. The boy cried for help, but no one believed him. The wolf took many sheep.
themed_passages.theme: Honesty is important because liars are not believed
evidence: The boy cried for help, but no one believed him

themed_passages.title: The Giving Tree
themed_passages.text: Maya found a stray kitten in the rain. She shared her lunch and made a shelter from boxes. Her friends saw this and helped too. Soon the whole neighborhood was taking care of animals in need. Maya's small act of kindness had grown into something big.
themed_passages.theme: Small acts of kindness can inspire others
evidence: Her friends saw this and helped too
Maya's small act of kindness had grown into something big

themed_passages.title: Practice Makes Perfect
themed_passages.text: Aiden wanted to play basketball, but he couldn't make a basket. Every day after school, he practiced shooting. Some days he missed every shot. But he kept trying. After three months, he made the school team. His coach said he was one of the hardest workers.
themed_passages.theme: Hard work and persistence lead to success
evidence: Every day after school, he practiced shooting

themed_passages.title: The New Student
themed_passages.text: When Rosa moved to a new school, she felt alone. Nobody talked to her at lunch. Then Marcus sat next to her and asked about her favorite books. They discovered they both loved mysteries. By the end of the week, Rosa had made several new friends.
themed_passages.theme: Being kind to others can make a big difference
evidence: Marcus sat next to her and asked about her favorite books
Rosa had made several new friends

question_templates: How did {character} change from the beginning to the end?

character_passages.title: Emma's Project
character_passages.text: Emma was scared to present her science project. Her hands shook and her voice trembled. But she remembered what her dad said: 'Be brave, even when you're scared.' She took a deep breath and started talking. By the end, she was smiling. Her classmates clapped.
character_passages.why_changed: She faced her fear and succeeded

character_passages.title: Jake Learns to Share
character_passages.text: Jake never shared his toys. 'They're mine!' he would say. But when his cousin visited and had no toys, Jake saw how sad she looked. He gave her his favorite car to play with. Seeing her smile made Jake feel good. Now he shares all the time.
character_passages.why_changed: He saw how sharing made others happy

main_idea_passages.text: Honeybees are amazing insects. They make honey that we eat. They help flowers grow by spreading pollen. Without bees, many plants could not make seeds. Bees are very important to our world.
main_idea_passages.main_idea: Honeybees are important to our world

main_idea_passages.text: Recycling helps protect our planet. When we recycle paper, fewer trees are cut down. Recycling plastic keeps it out of the ocean. Recycling cans saves energy. Everyone can help by recycling at home.
details: keeps plastic out of the ocean

structure_stories.title: The Missing Lunch
structure_stories.beginning: Lily brought her favorite sandwich to school. She put it in her cubby.
structure_stories.middle: At lunchtime, her sandwich was gone! Lily looked everywhere. She asked her friends if they had seen it.
structure_stories.end: Her teacher found it had fallen behind the cubbies. Lily was so happy to eat her lunch.
structure_stories.solution: The teacher found it behind the cubbies

structure_stories.title: The Science Fair
structure_stories.beginning: Carlos wanted to win the science fair. He decided to make a volcano.
structure_stories.middle: The night before, his volcano wouldn't erupt. He tried everything but it didn't work. Carlos felt like giving up.
structure_stories.end: His mom helped him fix the mixture. At the fair, the volcano erupted perfectly. Carlos won second place!
structure_stories.solution: His mom helped him fix the mixture

fluency_passages.text: The sun was setting behind the mountains. Colors of orange, pink, and purple filled the sky. Birds flew home to their nests. A gentle breeze made the leaves dance. It was the perfect end to a summer day.

My grandfather tells the best stories. He talks about when he was young. He walked five miles to school every day. He had no TV or computers. But he had lots of adventures with his friends. I love listening to his stories.
